intro: Sempervivum heuffelii var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial succulent native to the Alps. It features rosettes of thick, fleshy, smooth leaves that are typically green with a bluish or reddish tinge. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and sunny environments, thriving in well-drained soil. Its hardy nature makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
